project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In JIRA we use either the auto-complete renderer or the select list renderer for the Affects and Fix Versions fields, both of which allow for multiple versions to be selected. When creating a new card in GreenHopper, the only option is a drop-down list which allows only a single version to be selected.

You can edit it later, but it should be possible to select multiple versions in the first place.
fields.summary: Ability to select multiple versions when creating a new card

fields.description:
Excel(Chart Data) exported from Version Statistic>Actions Menu>Excel(Chart Data) not correct as logged in JIRA.

The Issue ABC-123 have the following:

*History changes*

||Action||Old value||New Value||date||
|Time Spent	|	 |2 hours [ 7200 ]| 24/Sep/10 4:25 PM|
|Remaining Estimate|	|	 2 hours [ 7200 ]| 24/Sep/10 4:25 PM|
|Remaining Estimate	| 2 hours [ 7200 ]|	 4 hours [ 14400 ]|24/Sep/10 4:25 PM|
|Time Spent	| 2 hours [ 7200 ]|	 0 minutes [ 0 ]|24/Sep/10 4:26 PM|
|Remaining Estimate	| 4 hours [ 14400 ]	| 6 hours [ 21600 ]|24/Sep/10 4:26 PM|
|Original Estimate|	 6 hours [ 21600 ]	| 4 hours [ 14400 ]|24/Sep/10 4:26 PM|
|Remaining Estimate	| 6 hours [ 21600 ]	| 4 hours [ 14400 ]|24/Sep/10 4:26 PM|
|Time Spent	| 0 minutes [ 0 ]	| 2 hours [ 7200 ]|24/Sep/10 4:26 PM|
|Remaining Estimate	| 4 hours [ 14400 ]|	 2 hours [ 7200 ]|24/Sep/10 4:26 PM|
|Remaining Estimate	| 2 hours [ 7200 ]|	 0 minutes [ 0 ]|05/Oct/10 10:31 AM|
|Time Spent	| 2 hours [ 7200 ]	| 4 hours [ 14400 ]|05/Oct/10 10:31 AM|

*Work Log*
|logged work - 24/Sep/10 2:26 PM - edited|Time Worked:2 hours|
| logged work - 05/Oct/10 8:30 AM|Time Worked:2 hours|

And below is the data from the chart excel data via _cog icon>Excel(Chart data)_.

|Issue key|	Issue type|	Parent|	Summary|	Assignee|	Status|	Original estimate|	2-Aug|	3-Aug	|... |28-Sep|...|6-Oct|	7-Oct|...|	19-Oct|	...|	1-Nov	|2-Nov	|3-Nov|	...|23-Nov|
|ABC-123|	Sub-task	|ABC-100|	xxxxxxx|t901281	|Resolved|	4	                |4           |	4	            |4	|	8       |8  |     8   |6        | 6  |             6|      6|	6              |	6        |	6       |  6|6|

The excel data seems doesn't reflect what is being logged in JIRA.

According to JIRA history, the last changes in the worklog will the 2 hours time spents at 05/Oct/10. 
However according to excel data, there is not work /estimate time recored at 24-Sept and 05-Oct; apart from that time remaining increase to 8 hours. The data shows the first work logged at 7-Oct which is wrong.

And below is the data extract from the database worklog table.

23536, 33270, 'user1', '', , 'xxxxxx', '2010-09-24 16:26:42', 'user1', '2010-09-24 16:27:02', '2010-09-24 14:26:00', 7200
24161, 33270, 'user1', '', , 'xxxx.', '2010-10-05 10:31:22', 'user1', '2010-10-05 10:31:22', '2010-10-05 08:30:00', 7200

fields.description:
Drop down list (associated with Label) doesn't show in JIRA IFrame in Chrome.

Steps to replicate:
1) Click in Agile
2) Click "Edit in Jira" at the card menu(gear icon).
3) Type the component name and the suggestion drop down do not show.

Happen in Chrome, Safari5 and IE7. Firefox and IE8 are working.

Tested with Chrome 7, Firefox 3.6.12 and Internet Explorer 8 using a new JIRA instance.

fields.description:
I was trying to follow "White Belt" Greenhopper article, but cached an error while trying.
On the Planning Board every issue box has "Edit Story Points" control. Every time I try to change that value I got error, for example: "2.0 is not a valid number". 

Please see attached:
- error details from "catalina.out" (last error message in file)
- error window in .jpg file

Changing Story Points from edit issue screen works fine.
I guess it may have something to do with regional system settings for Poland. We do not use "." (dot) as decimal separator, we use "," (comma) instead.
fields.summary: Conversion error when trying to update story points from Agile Planning Board

fields.description:
While performing an action in GreenHopper, it would be interesting to include the field descriptions into the HTML code.

As advised in this post : http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACOM/Using+Javascript+to+set+custom+field+values

I use some JavaScript code (located on the description of a Field Configuration) to make some fields become hidden, mandatory, or to set default values on. All functions are placed on this description (they may be empty, but they are declared in each field). And in the Jira Footer, I just have to call each function. 

In my concern, using GreenHopper the description of these fields has ben disabled, and there isn't Jira footer anymore. Do we have a solution to activate field descriptoins in GreenHopper, which will enable my JavaScript functions in the HTML code?

Sincerely,

fields.description:
User wants to have the ability to type a URL which brings someone to a GreenHopper Chart. This means specify the project and specific fix version for a GreenHopper Chart (i.e issue/hour burndown)

From support request:
{quote}
I want to have a URL which brings someone to a GreenHopper burndown. I am able to bring some to a particular Project and a particular board type (e.g. chart) but from the URL I don't see how I can specify the "Fix Version" and data selection (Hours Burndown v. Issue Burndown etc.).

So for instance if I give someone this URL it is not in my control which "Fix Version" or data type (Hours v. Issue burndown) they will be looking at

http://jira.xx.com/secure/ChartBoard.jspa?selectedProjectId=10061&selectedBoardId=10180
{quote}
fields.summary: Have the ability to type a URL which brings someone to a GreenHopper Chart

When setting in "Field Configurations" the field 'Fix Version' to "Hide", GreenHopper's Cards simply disappear.

To fix this issue please follow the steps:

   1. Go to Administration Tab
   2. Field Configurations
   3. Select VHL Content/Standard (one at a time)
   4. Scroll down to find "Fix Version" and set it as "SHOW"
   5. Perform a reindex

This is what was causing issues to not be shown in GreenHopper.

I strogly suggest that when user install GreenHopper plugin, it must have the 'Fix Version' field as "Show". Otherwise other customers may experience this strange behaviour that is not that simple to understand, find and fix.

KB article: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Planning+and+Task+board+card%27s+are+not+visible

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In my team, currently we have a single product deployed in multiple regions. The application has 3 deployment units, each with independent major version, controlled by the PM committee - these are our top-level versions. Every time we produce a binary package for handing over for testing/deployment (few times a month), it gets assigned a version from external system - these are our child-versions (usually we use a xxx-NEXT as temporary name and rename it to xxx-4.0.107 on release). Since recently we started modeling timeboxes (sprints) as third level versions, nested under binary packages.

Here the problem begins - sometimes we spend multiple iterations to complete a feature, released as a binary package, sometimes within a single iteration we release multiple binary packages.

To complicate the matters even more, the system is targeting multiple regions.  Each region has scheduled deliveries and we model them as (guessed already?) - versions. This worked nice before we started using GH, as in plain JIRA we can assign a particular issue to multiple versions, and by this we can easily express that it's applicable to multiple region and communicate when it will become available.

There is value in using versions for the binary packages as that's how developers communicate the changes to the deployment teams. There is value in using versions for timeboxes, as that's how GH works. There is value in using versions to outline the deliveries for multiple regions, as this is what the business users are interested in tracking.

*The problem:* the GH version-hierarchy accepts only one leaf-level version and once we assign a version from the GH planning board it strips all other versions. 

*Proposal:* have the planning board calculate the difference in the hierarchy when we move versions and not to remove unrelated versions. For example, if we move an issue from 1.2-M4 to 1.3-M1, the difference is: remove 1.2-M4, remove 1.2, add 1.3, add 1.3-M1 - leave the rest intact. If we need the current GH behavior, we can still easily achieve it by manually synchronizing a version.
fields.summary: Make GH friendlier to multiple leaf-versions

fields.description:
(I admit: that this could be a JIRA base product issue, but starting with Greenhopper since that's where my epic types come from.)

Per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Setting+Up+Epics+for+your+Project, "An epic is essentially a large user story that can be broken up into several smaller user stories." For this to work, we need an easy way to separate an epic into stories _or_ associating existing stories with epics.

JIRA + Greenhopper does neither well.

Per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Working+with+Epics, the only way to associate the two is like telling a customer that, for each item he wants to buy, he must put the item down on the front desk, leave the store's front entrance, walk around to the back alley, re-enter through the back entrance, go to the back desk, ask for the item again, and then purchase it. Then he must go back and repeat it all for each additional item he wants to purchase.

How it should be done: If I am viewing an epic or story, provide an easy way to associate that item with an existing story or epic, respectively, without leaving that "viewing an epic or story page." The current process is way too convoluted and gets in the way of me managing my projects.
fields.summary: A project administrator can associate an existing or new story while viewing an epic (or vice versa) without leaving the "view epic (or story)" page

Steps to reproduce:

# In 'Released Board', view the Release Notes of a version
# In the next screen, choose to 'Include Sub-Tasks'
# Switch to 'Preview HTML' tab. Sub-tasks are displayed fine
# Visit the permalink of the view (by clicking on the chain icon). Sub-tasks are now gone

Example URL: http://myjira/secure/RunPortlet.jspa?portletKey=com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-releasenotes&projectid=10000&fields=&versionId=10000&includeSubs=false

Toggling 'includeSubs' to 'true' does not make any difference either.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks excluded from HTML release notes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We are using a Kanban-Board in our team. On this board, all features and tasks are tracked. This board contains several different versions we are currently implementing. No we have evaluated Greenhopper. Is it possible to show more than one version in one Task-/Release-Board? How can I manage to move the current Kanban-Board to Greenhopper?
fields.summary: Kanban board in Greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
# From the planning page, click on a issue to view it (it popups in an iframe)
# Edit the issue, type in an autocomplete field like affects version
Autocomplete does not work, but when you close the iframe/popup you can see the autocomplete contents at the end of the planning page in green hopper.

Not sure if its a jira bug or green hopper bug, but should be fixed nonetheless.
fields.summary: Autocomplete for view issue in iframe is added to the bottom of the green hopper agile page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our product management team is excited about using GreenHopper to help track projects etc.  But they have found a limitation that is bothersome.  

The cards that are printed by GreenHopper are to small.
They would like to have them print like a standard 3X5 card, or have the ability to change size and/or the number of cards that print to a page.
fields.summary: GreenHopper Printing of cards needs to have the ability to size the cards or change the number of cards on a page.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Very difficult to perform a inline edit operation in IE 8 and Google Chrome. This issue has been newly introduced in GH 5.2.3. This is happening on both Browsers (Goole Chrome 6.0 & IE 8), but it is working perfectly in Firefox. 

This issue was found in Planning and Task board (List, Summary and Card view)
fields.summary: In line edit issue - IE 8 and Google Chrome 6.0

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Spelling error in dialogs. See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Misspelt "charaters" in "NEW Task" and "NEW Sub-task" dialogs

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Version Parent filed is too short, so it's hard to read the long version names.

!versionscut.jpg!

Thiago Auler
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Parent Version field is too short

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We got custom validator which enforces that business value and size values are in predefined set.
If user enters wrong value that validator shows following message on base JIRA

222 is not allowed. (Allowed values[1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13])

GreenHopper shows following message

Error occurred while creating issue through workflow: : Failed to create Issue

That is very confusing for users since they don't have any way to know what went wrong.
Is there any way to properly show those validator messages on GH? (Since that validator was developed in house we can easily change its code if necessary.)
fields.summary: Custom validator messages are not rendered properly on GreenHopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Document the "Field" field in the configuration for GreenHopper Statistics Burndown Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great to be able to add field names to cards in Summary view. Specifically, we are displaying Original Estimate and Time Spent and it is really hard to tell which is which.
fields.summary: Add labels to fields on cards in Summary view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently its only possible to add statics per project. This request is to allow for a more granular configuration- statistics per version within a project.

Screenshot shows an example of this- Iteration 51 has a different Story Point range than Iteration 52. Also applies to different fields, etc
fields.summary: Allow statics per version in the planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi, as a GH / Kanban user, I would like to have explicit WIP limits displayed on the Task Board so that rules are clearly visible for all team members. I have attached a screenshot how it may look like.

Thanks.
fields.summary: As a GH / Kanban user, I would like to have explicit WIP limits on the Task Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi, Atlassian has already done a great job for Kanban aficionados. However, IMHO a useful feature is missing: flagging tickets as Ready to be pulled. There may be two ways of achieving this feature:

* By providing a simple flag, similar to "Impediment" (cf. screenshot #1).
* Or by splitting each column in two sub-columns, the second of which representing items ready to be pulled (cf. screenshot #3).

Thanks!
fields.summary: As a GH / Kanban user, I would like to flag a ticket as Ready

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Click on a new card to open the issue iframe
# In the iframe, browse to Agile tab
# Create a new card within the iframe

Under a 1024x768 and 1280x800 with maximized browser window, the "Create" button can barely clickable. In lower resolutions, the button will be off screen.
fields.summary: Cards inside iframe cannot be submitted due to button offset

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a dashboards user I would like to see the Standard Issue Count in the Statistics Burndown Chart Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a project manager I would like to see the avatar of the currently assigned user on the card

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a project manager I would like to see the number of days a card has been in the same state

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a project manager I would like to spread one Kanban WIP limit across multiple subcolumns

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Jira 4.1.2 introduced new option in General Configuration:
"Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" and the Greenhopper plugin should be using it.
fields.summary: Greenhopper plugin doesn't use jira date settings

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a user, I want to release a version from the task board considering the context selected.
----
The "Release version from task board" feature doesn´t consider the task board context. This is important, because the sprint can have multiple product stories, and I want to release only 5 ou 6 stories related to one product. The context filters the stories, but I can´t release only the filtered stories.
fields.summary: When releasing new version from task board, the system must consider the task board context.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The Agile Gadget is great, but I need to have the ability to separate the "Info" and "Issues" tabs and the "roadmap" progress bar onto 3 separate gadgets.
fields.summary: Issue burndown chart gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would like to have a pie chart (and bar), that shows the different task board status instead of issue status. I have over 15 different statuses for all of the issue types in a release and there is no way (right now) to show them all in a comprehensive way on a dashboard rolled up. I have found that I can roll up the statuses with the taskboard, however, I can not access that information via the dashboard. It might make sense to implement custom colors (see feature GHS-2514) for the different statuses for when they show up on the pie chart.

taskboard.png shows the 5 statuses I have. 
pie.png shows them in a pie chart.
roadmap.png shows the statuses in a roadmap bar chart.
fields.summary: Custom Task board Statuses reflected in Dashboard Gadgets

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I may not use these statuses like everyone else. I do not drag drop the issues between statuses, I use it as kind of a dashboard that shows the progress of the release.

Currently I have 5 Statuses: Todo, In Spec, In Development, In QA and done.

I would like to be able to assign each of these a different color so that the colors in the taskboard line up with the different statuses. For instance Red, Orange, Yellow, Blue and Green.

These status colors should also make their way into the agile gadget and show up there when showing the various statuses.
fields.summary: Set Colors for Custom Taskboard mappings in Agile Taskboard and Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I was looking for a solution to remove the Assignee dropdown from the "New Card" Screen, to ensure auto assignment after creating tasks. This didnt work, by simply removing the field from the screens in JIRA, because Greenhopper does not respect the screen configuration of JIRA.

Is there any way to remove the assignee field from the create screen?
fields.summary: As a admin, I want to remove the assignee field from the "New Card" and "New Sub-Task" screen on the planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create an issue in GreenHopper
# Set an "Original Estimate"
# View the Burndown Chart
# Delete the previous set "Original Estimate" (It should get to N/A)
# View the burndown Chart didn't changed, it continues counting the estimate for the issue

Workaround:
- Set the "Original Estimate" as "0m", instead of deleting it.
fields.summary: Deleting an Original Estimate doesn't change the burndown chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The online documentation for Greenhopper states "Guideline. This is computed with the remaining estimates, not the original estimates" 

However the hour burndown chart for one of our sprints is using original estimates not remaining estimates
fields.summary: Guideline on hour burndown chart uses original estimates not remaining estimates

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*How to reproduce:* On any view with draggable cards click an editable card field.
*Expected:* the clicked field switches to edit mode.
*Actual:* almost always the card is shown as dragged and instantly released.

This issue is reproduced in *Google Chrome* _(tested 6.0.472.63 and 7.0.517.24 beta)_ on *Windows*. Chrome on Mac as well as FireFox on Windows works fine.

Probably related to GHS-2366
fields.summary: Instead of editing a field of a card when clicking on it, the card goes into drag mode (in Chrome/WinXP)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is a great feature. The same feature request we are looking for an improvement in GH.

If that feature support to release a selected stories and bugs based on Context filter. 

In our environment, time to time we release hot fixes and patches to the client. We like to hear if any plans for an enhance for this feature. 
 

Thanks,
GangaS
fields.summary: Version Release from the Task Board 'Done' Column for selected Stories and Bugs
